result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathan L. Rivera was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay Court costs, fees,assessments & surcharges, including DNA surcharge, to be paid by 08-01-15.  Any unpaid balance will be due forthwith.  Failure to pay will result in a  civil judgment.

Consecutive to: to any sentence, Straight Time.  Court notes a strong objection to Electronic Monitoring. 

Defendant is ordered to provide a DNA sample if not already done.

Court advised defendant of the following restrictions:
Firearm Possession and Voting.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jonathan L. Rivera

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: NO REPLY FROM SURETY OR DEFENDANT.
Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($500.00) ad
State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.

Defendant Jonathan L. Rivera in court with attorney Kristian Kanekoa Lindo.  Defendant Jonathan L. Rivera in custody. Brandon Wigley for Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
AS TO COUNT  1- 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
Court ordered defendant to serve 100 DAYS in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence; straight time; credit for 56 days time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. 
- Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
Due to previous non appearances, Court orders that if there is any cash bail on deposit it is now forfeited.
Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to paid by 8/1/2015. If there is any remaining balance it will be due FORTHWITH and an immediate entry of a civil judgment is ordered by the court.  

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.
Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 
Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
signed Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  All previous conditions remain including The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.   No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Attorney Kristian Kanekoa Lindo in court, defendant Jonathan L. Rivera not in court, in custody.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for Return on Warrant. Court addresses bail. Arguments heard as to bail. Court sets cash bail. 
Defense requests case be set for Plea and Sentencing. Court orders case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing on 12-17-2014 at 1:30 p.m., Br. 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 17, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney James Edgar Toran in court, defendant Jonathan L. Rivera not in court, in custody.  Brandon A. Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for Return on Warrant. Case held off the record as the Court is in a Jury Trial in another case. Case is rescheduled for Return on Warrant on 11-14-2014 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.  Return on warrant scheduled for November 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Bench warrant served. Original in Court file.
No reply from surety/defendant.
Defendant's Bail Forfeiture Notice returned undeliverable.
Notice of Bail/Bond Forfeiture
Notice of bail/bond forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($250.00) ad
Justice Point Discharge Summary received and filed.  alp
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney James E Toran in court.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant was ordered by the Court to appear at JusticePoint prior to case being called on the record. JusticePoint indicate Defendant never signed in. Agent paged the Defendant. Defendant did not appear at JusticePoint.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued. No bail ordered forfeited.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
All conditions of bail remain the same.  Justice Point monitoring to resume upon release.
Bench warrant served; original in file.  Case remains set for plea hearing on 5-7-14, 8:30.
(2) JusticePoint violations filed with the court.  alp
Justice Point Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed.    hgj

Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 250.00.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, recompense is not an issue.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Jonathan L. Rivera not in court.  Lucy J. Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear AT JUSTICE POINT AS ORDERED BY THE COURT, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.

Defendant Jonathan L. Rivera in court with attorney Louis E. Epps who appears as a friend of the Court and for Attorney James Toran.  Tyrone Martin St Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT THE COURT FILE.  Present in court is Justice Point Case worker Carly Manske.  Case in court due to violation.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court orders defendant to report to Justice Point tomorrow morning at 8:30 a.m. for drug test.
Defendant Jonathan L. Rivera in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jonathan L. Rivera in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Randy Sitzberger for Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 2/25/14.

Defendant Jonathan L. Rivera in court.  Hanna Kolberg for Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
This case was scheduled for the morning calendar, defendant appears in the afternoon.  Defendant has obtained Attorney Toran who was not available for today's proceedings.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Defendant is admonished for not appearing this morning.  Defendant is admonished for the Justice Point Violation Reports.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 26, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 2/14/14.

Defendant Jonathan L. Rivera in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent, as a friend of the court.  Karen Ann Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
NO FILE IN COURT. 
Case heard for Br. 26. 
Defendant appears in court on a refusal. Defendant can't provide specimen for baseline testing. The state asks the Defendant be ordered in for 2/14/2014. Court orders Defendant to return for testing to Justice Point on 2/11/14 at 1:30 p.m.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  To be monitored by drug testing.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Jonathan L. Rivera in court with attorney Victoria M McCandless.  Defendant Jonathan L. Rivera in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings. 
 DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
